did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: DeLossie Tuttle was an undergraduate at the Woman's College at Duke University from 1948-1952.

The collection includes grade reports, college papers, Duke calendars and schedule books, entertainment programs, Duke songbooks and handbook, photographs, a scrapbook, and artifacts such as a Duke pillow and wooden Duke Blue Devil statue. The collection ranges in date from circa 1948-1952.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], DeLossie D. Tuttle Papers, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The DeLossie D. Tuttle papers were received by the University Archives as a gift in 2004.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession A2004-3 is described in this finding aid.
Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and our local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

bioghist.p: DeLossie Dean Tuttle was a student at the Woman's College at Duke University from 1948-1952. She graduated with an A.B. degree in Mathematics in 1952. She was a member of the Alpha Chi Omega Sorority and member of Pi Mu Epsilon. Tuttle made the Dean's List her freshman-junior years and was a member of the Duke Players throughout her student career.

scopecontent.p: Collection includes grade reports, receipts for charges such as tuition and room/board, Student Activities Pay Day receipts, graduation materials, Alpha Chi Omega materials, photographs, record albums, and Duke-related artifacts.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

did.unittitle: College Papers (including grade reports, tuition receipts, Phi Beta Kappa handbook)
Photographs, black and white, Woman's College buildings, parade floats and individuals, possibly taken during Homecoming
Alpha Chi Omega materials (including pledge manual, banquet programs, and "Songs of Alpha Chi Omega")
Alpha Chi Omega photographs, black and white
Assorted University materials (including handbooks and "Duke Songs")
Duke pillow, felt material, ribbon with year 1952 on it
Lambda Chi Alpha (fraternity) garter (yellow, green and purple with lace)
Carter Hoffman original Duke Blue Devil statue (carved wood and hand-painted)
Alpha Chi Omega pin (has the number 50 on it)
Album Book (includes 3 albums featuring the Men's Glee Club and the Chapel Choir)
Photographs, black and white, some are on pages from a scrapbook and duplicate photos in folder 2
Two pages from a scrapbook which include napkins
